data.text: If thou be made the master of a feast, lift not thyself up,
And when thou hast done all thy office, take thy place,
Speak, thou that art the elder, for it becometh thee, but with sound judgment;
Pour not out words where there is a musician,
A concert of music in a banquet of wine
As a signet of an emerald set in a work of gold,
Speak, young man, if there be need of thee:
Let thy speech be short, comprehending much in few words;
If thou be among great men, make not thyself equal with them;
Before the thunder goeth lightning;
Rise up betimes, and be not the last;
There take thy pastime, and do what thou wilt:
And for these things bless him that made thee,
Whoso feareth the Lord will receive his discipline;
He that seeketh the law shall be filled therewith:
They that fear the Lord shall find judgment,
A sinful man will not be reproved,
A man of counsel will be considerate;
Do nothing without advice;
Go not in a way wherein thou mayest fall,
Be not confident in a plain way.
And beware of thine own children.
In every good work trust thy own soul;
He that believeth in the Lord taketh heed to the commandment;
